Quote: He shut down at one o’clock. He had written two pages, and the feeling that he was reverting to the nervous and neurotic man who’d almost burned down his house three years ago was getting harder to dismiss.
Title: If it Bleeds
Author: Stephen King

Quote: Shortly before 1 a.m., he answered a knock at the back door and admitted five men, two of whom were expert carpenters.
Title: The Nameless Ones
Author: John Connolly

Quote: I want to shout and scream, but I would be screaming at a wall. I storm off to my bedroom. Thirty minutes later, she leaves the house with Gboyega.  She doesn’t return till 1 a.m. I don’t sleep till 1 a.m.
Title: My Sister, The Serial Killer
Author: Oyinkan Braithwaite

Quote: It was one o’clock when we left No. 3, Lauriston Gardens. Sherlock Holmes led me to the nearest telegraph office, whence he dispatched a long telegram. He then hailed a cab, and ordered the driver to take us to the address given us by Lestrade
Title: A Study in Scarlet
Author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Quote: “Nobody noticed that he got off the ride without his date?” “Nope. This was mid-July, the very height of the season, and the place was a swarming madhouse. They didn’t find the body until one o’clock the next morning, long after the park was closed and the Horror House work-lights were turned on. For the graveyard shift, you know.”
Title: Joyland
Author: Stephen King

Quote: It was nearly one o’clock when Sherlock Holmes returned from his excursion. He held in his hand a sheet of blue paper, scrawled over with notes and figures.
Title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
Author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Quote: “Can’t do it, Findle; I’m with somebody else! Call me up to-morrow about one o’clock!”
Title: This Side of Paradise
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: “About one o’clock they moved to Maxim’s, and two found them in Deviniere’s. Sloane had been drinking consecutively and was in a state of unsteady exhilaration, but Amory was quite tiresomely sober; they had run across none of those ancient, corrupt buyers of champagne who usually assisted their New York parties. "
Title: This Side of Paradise
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

Quote: The more he thought about it the more puzzled he was… He didn’t understand this revolver business… Somebody in the house had got that revolver… Downstairs a clock struck one.
Title: And Then There Were None
Author: Agatha Christie

Quote: 1.00 am. I felt the surrounding quietness suffocating me.
Title: Sister
Author: Rosamund Lupton

Quote: He didn’t know what was at the end of the chute. The opening was narrow (though large enough to take the canary). He dreamed that the chute opened onto vast garbage bins filled with old coffee filters, ravioli in tomato sauce and mangled genitalia. Huge worms, as big as the canary, armed with terrible beaks, would attack the body. Tear off the feet, rip out its intestines, burst the eyeballs. He woke up, trembling; it was only one o’clock. He swallowed three Xanax. So ended his first night of freedom.
Title: Atomised
Author: Michel Houellebecq

Quote: I looked attentively at her, as she put that singular question to me. It was then nearly one o'clock. All I could discern distinctly by the moonlight was a colourless, youthful face, meagre and sharp to look at about the cheeks and chin; large, grave, wistfully attentive eyes; nervous, uncertain lips; and light hair of a pale, brownish-yellow hue.
Title: The Woman in White
Author: Wilkie Collins

Quote: I'm the only one awake in this house on this night before the day that will change all our lives. Though it's already that day: the little luminous hands on my alarm clock (which I haven't set) show just gone one in the morning.
Title: Tomorrow
Author: Graham Swift

Quote: It was the thirtieth of May by now. One am on the thirtieth of May 1940. Quite a famous date on which to be lying awake and staring at the ceiling. Already in the creeks and tidal estuaries of England the pleasure-boats and paddle-steamers were casting their moorings for the day trip to Dunkirk. And, over on the other side, Ted stood as a good a chance as anyone else.
Title: London Belongs to Me
Author: Norman Collins

Quote: Last night of all, When yon same star that's westward from the pole Had made his course t'illume that part of heaven Where now it burns, Marcellus and myself, The bell then beating one -
Title: Hamlet
Author: William Shakespeare

Quote: The station was more crowded than he had expected to find it at - what was it? he looked up at the clock - one o'clock in the morning. What in the name of God was he doing on King's Cross station at one o'clock in the morning, with no cigarette and no home that he could reasonably expect to get into without being hacked to death by a homicidal bird?
Title: The Long Dark Tea-time of the Soul
Author: Douglas Adams

Quote: ‘What time is it now?’ she said. ‘About one o’clock’. ‘In the morning?’ Herera’s friend leered at her. ‘No, there’s a total eclipse of the sun’.
Title: Freedom
Author: Jonathan Frantzen

Quote_Time: a little after one in the morning
Quote: We stand in front of the TV, soaking up news reports that break in between infomercials. At a little after one in the morning, we learn that the girl was taken to a burn center in South Bay. Ten minutes later, we learn she’s in critical condition.
Title: November 9
Author: Colleen Hoover

Quote: Unable to stop himself, like a magnet to strange behaviors and intrigue, the boy detective begins taking notes in his small notepad: 1:03am: Subject: Effie Mumford, female, age eleven, blond, in a white and purple winter jacket. Testing a new rocket perhaps?
Title: The Boy Detective Fails
Author: Joe Meno

Quote: She had called twice during the twenty-four hours following the old bastard’s stroke, when it became obvious he was going to snuff it. The phone had not been answered either time. She called again after her father died — this time at 1:04 on the morning of August 2nd. Some drunk had answered the telephone.
Title: The Tommyknockers
Author: Stephen King

Quote: I look over at the clock, It’s only five minutes after one. What could another ten minutes really do?
Title: Stella Díaz Dreams Big
Author: Angela Dominguez

Quote: When he woke it was 1:06 by the digital clock on the bedside table. He lay there looking at the ceiling, the raw glare of the vaporlamp outside bathing the bedroom in a cold and bluish light. Like a winter moon.
Title: No Country for Old Men
Author: Cormac McCarthy

Quote: It was 1.08a.m. but he had left the ball at the same time as I did, and had further to travel.
Title: The Rosie Project
Author: Graeme Simsion

Quote: They made an unostentatious exit from their coach, finding themselves, when the express had rolled on into the west, upon a station platform in a foreign city at nine minutes past one o'clock in the morning - but at length without their shadow.
Title: The Black Bag
Author: Louis Joseph Vance

Quote: It was at ten minutes past one by Bond’s watch when, at the high table, the whole pattern of play suddenly altered.
Title: Casino Royale
Author: Ian Fleming

Quote: February 26, Saturday - Richards went out 1.10am and found it clearing a bit, so we got under way as soon as possible, which was 2:10a.m.
Title: South: The Endurance Expedition
Author: Ernest Shackleton

Quote_Time: nearer to one than half past
Quote: Declares one of the waiters was the worse for liquor, and that he was giving him a dressing down. Also that it was nearer to one than half past.
Title: The Affair at the Victory Ball
Author: Agatha Christie

Quote: It was 1:12am when Father arrived at the police station. I did not see him until 1:28am but I knew he was there because I could hear him. He was shouting, 'I want to see my son,' and 'Why the hell is he locked up?' and, 'Of course I'm bloody angry.'
Title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
Author: Mark Haddon

Quote: “I got hit twelve, thirteen minutes after one. Anybody at the Tribune you can call and sweet-talk? Find out what time they got the tip?”
Title: Little Underworld
Author: Chris Harding Thornton

Quote: At eleven minutes past one A.M. (Greenwich time), the fresh rope was going over the stern, and the screw engines going ahead at thirteen minutes past one. A watch of four men is now stationed, fore and aft, all along the trough, which is illuminated by many lamps at short distances from each other.
Title: The Story of the Atlantic Telegraph
Author: Henry M. Field

Quote: That was Friday, at fourteen minutes after one. Cara emailed her the consignment forms. Celia wanted the forms sent to her own email address so she could review them in advance.
Title: Hidden Treasure
Author: Jane K. Cleland

Quote: “Dean was with Allison that night, from sometime right before ten until fourteen minutes past one, which I'm sure I don't have to remind you is a good hour past Ella Mae's time of death.
Title: Trust No One
Author: Kimberly Belle

Quote: I am sorry, therefore, as I have said, that I ever paid any attention to the footsteps. They began about a quarter past one o'clock in the morning, a rhythmic, quick-cadenced walking around the dining-room table.
Title: "My Life and Hard Times: "The Night the Ghost Got In"
Author: James Thurber

Quote: Lily Chen always prepared an 'evening' snack for her husband to consume on his return at 1.15am.
Title: Sour Sweet
Author: Timothy Mo

Quote: The ghost that got into our house on the night of November 17, 1915, raised such a hullabaloo of misunderstandings that I am sorry I didn't just let it keep on walking, and go to bed. Its advent caused my mother to throw a shoe through a window of the house next door and ended up with my grandfather shooting a patrolman. I am sorry, therefore, as I have said, that I ever paid any attention to the footsteps. They began about a quarter past one o'clock in the morning, a rhythmic, quick-cadenced walking around the dining-room table.
Title: "My Life and Hard Times: "The Night the Ghost Got In" "
Author: James Thurber

Quote: At sixteen past one, they walked into the interview room.
Title: Nothing Gold Can Stay
Author: Dana Stabenow

Quote: From 1am to 1.16am vouched for by other two conductors.
Title: Murder on the Orient Express
Author: Agatha Christie

Quote: At that moment (it was seventeen minutes past one in the morning) Lieutenant Bronsfield was preparing to leave the watch and return to his cabin, when his attention was attracted by a distant hissing noise.
Title: A voyage round the moon
Author: Jules Verne

Quote: The clocks stopped at 1:17. A long shear of light and then a series of low concussions. He got up and went to the window. What is it? she said. He didnt answer. He went into the bathroom and threw the lightswitch but the power was already gone. A dull rose glow in the windowglass. He dropped to one knee and raised the lever to stop the tub and then turned on both taps as far as they would go. She was standing in the doorway in her nightwear, clutching the jamb, cradling her belly in one hand. What is it? she said. What is happening?
Title: The Road
Author: Cormac McCarthy

Quote: It was eighteen minutes after one. A wash of yellow light seeped from under her bedroom door. “Samantha,” he tapped lightly. “Yes, Dave?” “I can't sleep – do you want a cup of tea?” “Yes please – I can't sleep either.”
Title: Missing: Presumed Dead
Author: James Hawkins

Quote: I first saw Mr. Wiggenhall at eighteen minutes past one. He was then in a state of collapse. In my opinion he must have taken the poison some time before that.”
Title: Death Sits on the Board
Author: John Rhode

Quote: It is nineteen minutes after one on a summer night. And if only I felt a bit hungry this is what I should wish—spread out on a damask cloth before me in a few gold-medallioned Chinese dishes, with no forks or knives: first of all, two thin foie-gras sandwiches, four grilled snails and maybe a little alligator pear: on top of those, two truffles: on top of those, two slim onions: on top of those, two thin salted biscuits: on top of those, a bit of Camembert cheese: on top of that, two cigarettes: on top of all a hollow-stemmed glass of sparkling Burgund.
Title: I, Mary MacLane: A Diary of Human Days
Author: Mary MacLane

Quote: Nineteen minutes past one o'clock. He threw off the covers and got out of bed. He was in his long underwear. His blue jeans and a flannel shirt were close at hand, folded over the back of an armchair, beside which stood a pair of boots.
Title: Winter Moon
Author: Dean Koontz

Quote: I woke up and glanced at my watch on the table next to my bed. It was one twenty. My heart was beating furiously. I slid off the bed down onto the carpet, sat cross-legged, and took some deep breaths. Then I held my breath, relaxed my shoulders, sat up straight, and tried to focus. I must have swum too much, I decided, or got too much sun.
Title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: "Well!" she said, looking like a minor female prophet about to curse the sins of the people. "May I trespass on your valuable time long enough to ask what in the name of everything bloodsome you think you're playing at, young piefaced Bertie? It is now some twenty minutes past one o'clock in the morning, and not a spot of action on your part."
Title: Jeeves and the Feudal Spirit
Author: P.G. Wodehouse

Quote: Then it was 1.20am, but I hadn't heard Father come upstairs to bed. I wondered if he was asleep downstairs or whether he was waiting to come in and kill me. So I got out my Swiss Army Knife and opened the saw blade so that I could defend myself.
Title: The Curious Incident Of The Dog In The Night-Time
Author: Mark Haddon

Quote: According to the clock it's twenty-one minutes past one. Last time I looked up the hands showed eighteen minutes past. Three minutes, and yet to me it has seemed like an eternity.
Title: The Temptation to Be Happy
Author: Lorenzo Marone

Quote: It happens in the early hours, at twenty-one minutes past one. I recognise the car from the bonnet. A red Toyota Avensis. The car glides forwards, slowly and surely.
Title: The Moose Paradox
Author: Antti Tuomainen

Quote: It was 1:22 when we found Dad's grave.
Title: Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close
Author: Jonathan Safran Foer

Quote: The clock marked twenty-three minutes past one. He was suddenly full of agitation, yet hopeful. She had come! Who could tell what she would say? She might offer the most natural explanation of her late arrival.
Title: A Mummer's Tale
Author: Anatole France

Quote: Larkin had died at 1.24am, turning to the nurse who was with him, squeezing her hand, and saying faintly, 'I am going to the inevitable.'
Title: Body Parts: Essays on Life-Writing
Author: Hermione Lee

Quote: He made a last effort; he tried to rise, and sank back. His head fell on the sofa cushions. It was then twenty-five minutes past one o'clock.
Title: The Moonstone
Author: Wilkie Collins

Quote: When I reached the stop and got off, it was already one twenty-six A.M. by the bus's own clock. I had been gone over ten hours.
Title: The Silver Metal Lover
Author: Tanith Lee

Quote: At twenty-seven minutes past one she felt as if she was levitating out of her body.
Title: Trackers
Author: Deon Meyer

Quote: It was 1:12 am when Father arrived at the police station. I did not see him until 1:28 am but I knew he was there because I could hear him. He was shouting, 'I want to see my son,' and 'Why the hell is he locked up?' and, 'Of course I'm bloody angry.'
Title: The Curious Incident Of The Dog In The Night-Time
Author: Mark Haddon

Quote: He exited the men's room at one-twenty-nine A.M.
Title: The Narc
Author: William Edmund Butterworth

Quote: She glanced at her bedside clock. One thirty. Beneath the hands, tiny ivory-inlaid sheep jumped over a stile. Papa had designed it for her and she found herself counting the creatures now, trying to ignore the whirr of her mind as she closed her eyes and drifted off into an uneasy sleep full of silver-eyed men and skull-topped canes.
Title: Cogheart
Author: Peter Bunzl

Quote: Rose continued her meditations until one thirty that Monday morning. The rest of the True (with the exception of Apron Annie and Big Mo, currently watching over Grampa Flick) were sleeping deeply when she decided she was ready.
Title: Doctor Sleep
Author: Stephen King

Quote: The following day, at one-thirty, I call on Van Norden. It’s his day off, or rather his night off. He has left work with Carl that I am to help him move today.  I find him in a state of unusual depression. He hasn’t slept a wink all night, he tells me. There’s something on his mind, something that’s eating him up.
Title: Tropic of Cancer
Author: Henry Miller

Quote: "Half-past one”, The street lamp sputtered, The street lamp muttered, The street lamp said, "Regard that woman ..."
Title: Rhapsody on a Windy Night
Author: TS Eliot

Quote: Around 1:30 A.M. the door opened and I thought it was Karla, but it was Bug, saying Karla and Laura had gone out for a stag night after they ran out of paint.
Title: Microserfs
Author: Douglas Coupland

Quote: The late hour helped. It simplified things. It categorized the population. Innocent bystanders were mostly home in bed. I walked for half an hour, but nothing happened. Until one thirty in the morning. Until I looped around to 22nd and Broadway.
Title: Gone Tomorrow
Author: Lee Child

Quote: The radio alarm clock glowed 1:30 a.m. Bad karaoke throbbed through walls. I was wide awake, straightjacketed by my sweaty sheets. A headache dug its thumbs into my temples. My gut pulsed with gamma interference: I lurched to the toilet.
Title: Ghostwritten
Author: David Mitchell

Quote: At one thirty in the morning, we learn she has suffered fourth-degree burns over thirty percent of her body.
Title: November 9
Author: Colleen Hoover

Quote: This time, she was not alarmed when her husband stirred, looked quizzically at her, and then at the clock on the wall that read twenty-nine minutes to two o'clock in the morning. She did not shut her eyes tightly as she did before. Rather, she looked directly into her husband's eyes and spoke.
Title: Islands of Goodness
Author: Bassey Ubong

Quote: I sat down on the couch again and looked at my watch It was one thirty-two. I shut my eyes and focused on a spot in my head. My mind a total blank, I gave myself up to the sands of time and let the flow take me wherever it wanted.
Title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
Author: Haruki Murakami

Quote: She grinned at him with malicious playfulness, showing great square teeth, and then ran for the stairs. One-thirty-two. She thought that she heard a whistle blown and took the last three steps in one stride.
Title: Stamboul Train
Author: Graham Greene

Quote: He looked at his watch. One-thirty-three a.m. He had been asleep on this bench for over an hour and a half.
Title: Skeletons
Author: Kat Fox

Quote: Rock music played in the background at a low volume. He glanced at the clock on the nightstand that was thirty-four minutes past one in the morning. Ramiro continued writing lyrics. Song entitled: “MEET YOUR DEMISE”
Title: Irate
Author: Alexis Soleil

Quote: It was thirty-five minutes past one when he finally stopped the car in front of the crowded departure gates. He grabbed a luggage trolley and hoisted Shipra's medium-sized suitcase onto it.
Title: The Mountains Within
Author: Ram Thakur

Quote: On the north-east side of the street, about midway between the fish and flesh markets in the seaport town of Falmouth, and at about the silent and solemn hour of thirty-six minutes past one by my father's watch, on the morning of the 28th day of December, of the year of grace 1752, His Gracious Majesty George the Second being King of Great Britain and Ireland, (it is necessary in important matters to be particular).
Title: Hurricane Hurry
Author: William Henry Giles Kingston

Quote: At one-thirty-eight am suspect left the Drive-In and drove to seven hundred and twenty three North Walnut, to the rear of the residence, and parked the car.
Title: The Narc
Author: William Edmund Butterworth

Quote: I arrived at the community center building in the middle of Donniga at twenty-one minutes to two. The building was located on a gentle hillside overlooking a long and narrow lake that wound between the rolling hills to the southeast.
Title: The One-Eyed Man
Author: L. E. Modesitt, Jr.

Quote: March twelfth, one-forty am, she leaves a group of drinking buddies to catch a bus home. She never makes it.
Title: Bones to Ashes
Author: Kathy Reichs

Quote: And there was I, stuck like a fool in Union Square at nineteen minutes to two on the sixty-seventh morning of the peace or whatever it is, with the complete certainty that an invisible and silent bomb, doing no damage, had just gone off in front of me.”
Title: The Noises That Weren't There
Author: Charles Williams

Quote: and it was nineteen minutes to two when he returned, head first, with the phial still between his teeth, and the cotton-wool rammed home to still the rattling of that which lay like a great gray bean within.
Title: The Amateur Cracksman
Author: E. W. Hornbug

Quote: At seventeen minutes to two the artist threw down his brushes, laid his palette on a paint-spattered table and declared, 'There we are. That'll do. Enough.' The painting was finished.
Title: Folly
Author: Alan Titchmarsh

Quote: She knew it was the stress, two long days of stress, and she looked at her watch, sixteen minutes to two, and she almost leaped with fright, a shock wave rippling through her body, where had the time gone?
Title: Trackers
Author: Deon Meyer

Quote: At one forty-five, we learn that she is expected to survive, but will undergo extensive reconstructive surgery and rehabilitation.
Title: November 9
Author: Colleen Hoover

Quote: That particular phenomenom got Presto up at one forty-six a.m.; silently, he painted his face and naked body with camouflage paint. He opened the door to his room and stepped out into the common lobby.
Title: Fardnock's Revenge
Author: J.W. Stockton

Quote: “You're right,” she conceded, then playfully added, “are you sure he’s a robot?” “Yes, he's definitely a robot,” said Biscuit at thirteen minutes to two. “Too bad.” “Yeah, too bad.”
Title: Yellow Orang-Utan Industries
Author: Simon Gray

Quote: Captain Jeanniot took out his watch: “All right! it's only twelve minutes to two! I have a good 15 minutes to spare. But, by Jingo, how weary I feel! And how hungry I am too!”
Title: The confessions of arsène Lupin. The gentleman thief
Author: Maurice Leblanc

Quote: It was twelve minutes to two when the bathroom door opened again. Montalbano came out looking like a fashion plate: dressed to the nines, scented, and sporting shiny shoes.
Title: The Sicilian Method
Author: Andrea Camilleri

Quote: Vasquez was hungry after his gig. She peeked through the glass and saw Gloria doing the ordering for both of them, Marian checked the time: eleven minutes to two. Gloria had twenty-four thousand dollars in her bag, twenty-four to avoid a too-pat round number.
Title: The Apostrophe Thief
Author: Barbara Paul

Quote: She had to get out of this goddam camper. It might be the biggest, luxiest one in the world, but right now it felt the size of a coffin. She made her way to the door, holding onto things to keep her balance. She glanced at the clock on the dashboard before she went out. Ten to two. Everything had happened in just twenty minutes. Incredible.
Title: Doctor Sleep
Author: Stephen King

Quote: No, she thought: every spinster legal secretary, bartender, and orthodontist had a cat or two—and she could not tolerate (not even as a lark, not even for a moment at ten minutes before two AM), embodying cliché.
Title: Dog
Author: Michelle Herman

Quote: At one fifty, reporters state that the owner of the home admitted to spilling fuel near a car parked outside his garage. Investigators state they have no reason to believe the fire was caused intentionally, but a complete investigation will follow up to corroborate the homeowner’s claims.
Title: November 9
Author: Colleen Hoover

Quote: At nine minutes to two the other vehicle arrived. At first Milla didn't believe her eyes: that shape, those markings.
Title: Trackers
Author: Deon Meyer

Quote: It was eight minutes to two before we had any encouragement at all.
Title: The Rat Began to Gnaw the Rope
Author: C.W. Grafton

Quote: It’s seven minutes to one now, so we'll adjourn and restart proceedings at exactly seven minutes to two. 1.53.'
Title: The Road to Hell
Author: Gillian Galbraith

Quote: Left at seven minutes to two, arrived ten past. The lady was put in the taxi by a tall thin gentleman with a monocle and no chin, who gave him a fiver.
Title: Die Laughing
Author: Carola Dunn

Quote: Six minutes to two. Janina Mentz watched the screen, where the small program window flickered with files scrolling too fast to read, searching for the keyword.
Title: Trackers
Author: Dean Koontz

Quote: At four minutes to two, when the call to scramble came over the loudspeakers, he was actually moving, running across the grass.
Title: Full Circle
Author: Katie Flynn

Quote: Then I opened my eyes and looked at my watch. It was one fifty-seven. Twenty-five minutes had vanished somewhere. Not bad, I told myself. A pointless way of whittling away time. Not bad at all.
Title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
Author: Haruki Murakami
